item.title: Dangerous Overgrown Tree at rear of Torbrook Close/Oakway Close, 22nd September
item.description:
Two severely overgrown trees located in the garden of 6 Oakway Close, which back onto the rear of Torbrook Close. This matter has been reported previously but has not been dealt with. The trees are causing multiple serious hazards. Overhanging branches and falling debris are damaging vehicles on the private road behind the property. The public alleyway used daily by children attending Upton Road Primary School is directly under the falling debris, creating a risk of serious injury. Leaves have built up behind the fence, causing it to become unstable. A section of fencing has already collapsed into the alleyway, narrowly missing a child walking past. The trees continue to overhang a very long way beyond the property boundary, and the neighbour responsible does not appear to take proper care of them. This is now a major safety issue. Falling branches, unstable fencing, and heavy debris pose a real and immediate risk to both the public and residents. I request that the council urgently inspect these trees and take immediate action to make them safe before further damage or a serious accident occurs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torbrook Close, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
